body:
Could you check if this patch fixes it?
https://gist.github.com/narfbg/5412104

See notes at the patch (order of merge),
otherwise, the patch works for now (allthough a bit clunky function declaration under the query builder class :-) ).

issue.title: Query_builder reset_select issues (skipping reset select generates errors)

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

body: @GDmac Sorry, I'd love to take on this, but it's fairly complicated and I don't really have the time needed right now. I'll get back to it as soon as I can.

Why close this issue then?
Querybuilder-cache functionality is broken and breaks backward compatibility.
When closing the issue it might be left unnoticed by anybody who might be able to fix this.
Did you not see the commits?

Comments on above: i saw in query_builder that every add to cache also sets an entry for $this->qb_cache_exists. so first we eliminate duplicates for select, from, etc. Narf, that in_array() OR ... is a neat trick to remember. Then, i don't think there is a need for count on the cached vars at all, isn't qb_cache_exists enough? Then, the array_merge on qb_vars is not needed if we copy cached_vars and append any new qb values after already cached variables.
